Mathematical Reflection

In this unit, we use proportional relationships to investigate probability and solve problems. At the end of this investigation, ask yourself:

What do you know about probability? About proportional relationships?

Students can

  • use area models to represent situations to find the probability of occurrences.
  • use 10-by-10 grids as area models to find probability of occurrences using percents.
  • use theoretical probabilities from area models to scale up or down to make predictions, find long-term averages.
  • determine the probabilities for binomial events.
